abstract.text: An object that describes a single haptic or audio event.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Each event represents a single haptic or audio signal. The event
determines whether it’s audio or haptic. Use a

factory methods to play events. Haptic events can be transient or continuous. Transient haptic patterns are brief impulses that occur at a specific point in time, such as the haptic feedback you feel from swiping through a picker or toggling a switch. Continuous haptic patterns, like the vibration from a ringtone, take the form of lengthier feedback over a period of time.

In the following graphic, transient haptic patterns on the left trigger at a specific time with a specific intensity. Continuous haptic patterns on the right sustain the haptic feedback over a specific duration of time, such as three seconds.
Specify when an event begins by setting its
property. Specify the length of the event by setting its
property. Set optional parameters to customize event properties. For example, you can specify the intensity of a haptic event by creating an event parameter with ID

abstract.text: Compose and play haptic patterns to customize your iOS app’s haptic feedback.
A value that you send to a haptic pattern player to alter a property value during playback.
An object that represents the connection to the haptic server.
An object that describes a single haptic or audio event.
The types of audio and haptic event waveforms.
An identifier for an event parameter.
The strength of a haptic event.
The duration of the haptic event.
An array of event parameters, possibly empty.
Initializes a haptic event from a previously loaded audio resource, specifying event parameters and start time.
Initializes a haptic event from a previously loaded audio resource, specifying event parameters, start time, and duration.
Initializes a haptic event of the specified type, parameters, and start time.
Initializes a haptic event of the specified type, parameters, start time, and duration.
The start time of the event, relative to other events in the same pattern.
The type of the haptic event.
A static parameter value that represents a single property of the haptic pattern.
A curve that you send to a haptic pattern player to alter a property value gradually during playback.
A protocol that defines a standard pattern player capable of playing haptic patterns with fixed parameters.
Enhance your app’s experience by incorporating haptic and sound feedback into key interactive moments.

doc://com.apple.corehaptics/documentatio.title: Delivering Rich App Experiences with Haptics

abstract.text: Play a custom haptic pattern whose strength depends on an object’s collision speed.
Generate continuous and transient haptic patterns in response to user touch.

doc://com.apple.corehaptics/documentatio.title: Updating Continuous and Transient Haptic Parameters in Real Time

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
